atthejoyces1.description:
Sunday at the Joyces. As always, Amanda photographed our brood even more obsessively than we do.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
atthejoyces1.title: Atthejoyces 1

atthejoyces2.description:
We raced remote control cars at the local park.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
atthejoyces2.title: Atthejoyces 2

atthejoyces4.description:
Milo is the perfect target for Amanda's shutterbugging.
Photo by Amanda Joyce
atthejoyces4.title: Atthejoyces 4

atthejoyces5.description:
Felix and Keenan share a deep love of Legos. This time, Felix insisted that we bring quite accurate scale model of the European Space Agency's lunar orbiter SMART-1 he and Dean had built the day before.

SMART-1 crashed into the moon (on purpose) while we were at the Joyces.

Photo by Amanda Joyce
atthejoyces5.title: Atthejoyces 5

biking1.description: Felix is slowly getting more comfortable with his new bicycle. Milo, for the first time this week, managed to pedal his tricycle a few yards.
biking1.title: Biking 1

carrying.description: Felix likes carrying Milo. Milo has mixed feelings about it.
carrying.title: Carrying

lakeanza4.description: Felix is much more comfortable in the water since his swimming lessons. At Lake Anza, he got in the water all the way to his chest.
lakeanza4.title: Lakeanza 4

paves1.description: Our good friend Sasha Pave had twins two months ago. The one in the red pants is Owen, the other one is Isaac. Just to be absolutely sure there is no confusion, Sasha and Leslie painted Isaac's toenail blue.
paves1.title: Paves 1

paves2.description:
Milo loved the babies. He cooed at them and gave them little kisses. When Owen got hungry, he fed him a bottle.
Photo by Leslie Pave
paves2.title: Paves 2

pilot2.description: Felix has been playing Snakes on a Plane ever since Dean and Lucie got dressed up to go see it. His version is a bit tamer than the Hollywood production: he is a pilot who takes all of his pet snakes for a ride on his personal plane.
pilot2.title: Pilot 2

playdate1.description: Kora and Torin spent the night. Felix and Milo were both very glad to have their favorite sister duo over.
playdate1.title: Playdate 1

playdate4.description: Owen and Felix scale the mighty bunk bed, while Milo and Bena play doctor. We're very very happy that Felix's friends are now recognizing Milo as a worthy playmate. It has made playdates more fun for everyone.
playdate4.title: Playdate 4

playdate5.description:
Felix, Owen and Milo at Totland.

Owen's baby sister was born on August 18, 2006. Her name is Ada Jane. We haven't met her yet, but we are all looking forward to it.
playdate5.title: Playdate 5

playdate6.description: Felix, Owen, Milo, Dylan and Jordan at Totland. Jordan started preschool this week, marking the end of the Maria era.
playdate6.title: Playdate 6

rocket1.description:
Shooting a model rocket at the Berkeley Marina. It went up hundreds of feet!

Note the two toy trucks near the launch pad. They brought in new rocket engines and took old ones to the recycle center. Felix took his job as Captain of the Recovery Crew very seriously.
rocket1.title: Rocket 1

rocket2.description: Recovery Captain Felix, bringing the goods back. With the wind off the bay, the rocket went a LONG way.
rocket2.title: Rocket 2

rocket3.description: Inspired by the model rocket, Dean and Felix built a giant Lego version.
rocket3.title: Rocket 3

description:
School was closed this week. Lucie, Felix and Milo had 10 fun days of playdates, excursions and plain hanging out.

Felix is a scientist at heart. He is fascinated by why things are, and how things work. Not only is he constantly asking pertinent questions and gathering all sort of facts, he is also coming up with theories. For example, he explained to us how a diver's tank extracts oxygen from the surrounding water, so that the diver can breathe. That's not how it really works, so clearly he is not just regurgitating information, but it's an intersting idea.

Milo sings more and more. It's the cutest thing ever. In the morning when he wakes up, he often spends a good 5 minutes singing Old Mac Donald in his crib before asking to come out. Other current faves include Itsy Bitsy Spider, Bateau sur l'eau, Yellow Submarine and Dodo dodo, l'Enfant Do

Milo's language is improving on a daily basis. He is sort of talking in sentences now, saying things like “read that book please”, “bébé faim, bébé want biberon lait”, or “no want apple, want chocolate cookie”. His manners are excellent; always ready with a please and thank you.
title: September 6
